featured.text: When the shuttle touches the land, a drag parachute opens to steady the aircraft, get the speed right, and help the brakes on the landing-gear wheels to bring it to a complete stop. 49.
The moral lesson is that slow and steady wins the race.
The moral lesson is that 33 and consistent will always beat slow and steady.
A human body usually has a ________ temperature of about 37 degrees C. (A) steady (B) various (C) gradual (D) precious 8.
More and more new cars can reverse-park, read traffic signs, maintain a safe distance in steady traffic and brake automatically to avoid crashes.

definition.en_def: Firmly fixed, supported, or balanced; not shaking or moving.
definition.example: She held the camera steady to take a clear picture.
